Articles.Content:
For a class this semester I've been busily working on my own spaceship game. Like KSP, it involves building ships out of parts and then flying them. Unlike KSP, it's about using them to blow up other ships (no really, it's actually the point this time. I mean with actual weapons).

It's inspired by some semi-old 2D games such as [Battleships Forever](http://wyrdysm.com) and of course the KSP ship builder. Ships fly around using decidedly unrealistic physics, Star Wars-style, and the player must use a selection of ships and a good strategy to outmaneuver and defeat a group of enemies.

More information here: [http://helia.heliohost.org/4813/](http://helia.heliohost.org/4813/)

Latest development video:

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5v5bQc2kZM4?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

For now I have the working title of ~~"Space Pizza"~~ "StarBlast!", but I don't want to use that for the finished game ~~because, well, it's not about pizza (please contain your disappointment)~~ - so title suggestions are invited! Please give me *something* because I haven't been able to come up with anything decent on my own.

And even if you don't have a title suggestion, please do tell me what you think! Would you be interested in playing this game once I get around to making a download available? Are there features you think need to be added?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-17T07:45:22Z" title="12/17/2015 07:45  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 17, 2015</time> by parameciumkid**

Bump! This game project didn't die. Rather I've been working on it off and on for the past year and made tons of progress. The game is now known as "StarBlast!" and features a full Campaign Mode and an all-new fleet of sample ships and weapons:
